reviewText: I am leaving for a trip to disney in exactly one week and this would have been great on the train due to limited outlets.  However, 1st port doesn't work and I cannot even do an exchange. Only a refund. So now I am right back where I started. Anker is usually good about products, but this one is unreliable.  Edit port #2 just went. Piece of junk. I don't know if it is a coincidence or not but now to ipod cables no longer work in regular chargers after using them in this.Edit: received second one which worked fine and then had 5th or 1st port die. No power to it.Anker gave me a credit on their own for the second one for a positive review before this issue...  Sorry, I can't do that Anker.....I received a white replacement free of charge from Anker. It came in a larger package with a few pamphlets about Anker products, etc. as well as the directions.The white model charges my note 2 faster than the black one ever did.I still have a black one, so I tried it the other night.  With using one of the few good ports, my battery charged from 28% to 51% in 7 hours..... Horrible.The white one on the other hand, went from 48% to 98% in about 3.5 hours, while also having an ipad 2 plugged in.  One star off because it doesn't seem to top off like a regular dedicated charger, but the white one is far superior to the black one and Anker support has been great. I even get follow up emails to make sure the product is working, etc.Is it a crap shoot? Possibly. I think the black one is considered the outdated model and the new white one with the new technology is the way to go.
title: Anker® 40W 5-Port Family-Sized Desktop USB Charger with PowerIQ™ Technology for iPhone 5s 5c 5; iPad Air mini; Galaxy S5 S4; Note 3 2; the new HTC One (M8); Nexus and More (Black)

reviewText: This is one of those "must have" accessories.  Most tablets require A/C to charge.  They won't charge from a computer USB connection.  And smaller devices will charge both ways, but faster from A/C.  The problem starts growing when you have multiple devices and many of them have A/C plugs that are power converter blocks that take up excess space.  Along comes Anker to the rescue.  This connector block will support 5 devices and has the wattage/amperage to carry that load.  The power cord has a standard three prong A/C plug that takes up only one space.  On a trip, you only need this and the device USB charging cords.  No more multiple charger blocks hogging socket space.I have three cords connected, right now.  My smartphone, a case with built-in spare battery, and a powered external speaker.  If I ever get a smartwatch or any other device, I still have two open slots to charge them, while taking up only one A/C socket to handle it all.
title: Anker® 40W 5-Port Family-Sized Desktop USB Charger with PowerIQ™ Technology for iPhone 5s 5c 5; iPad Air mini; Galaxy S5 S4; Note 3 2; the new HTC One (M8); Nexus and More (Black)

reviewText: Wow!I was speechless when this came out, I swear Anker keeps outdoing themselves every time they release a new product.Too bad I have an addiction and always want to try the newest and the best. I have attached some pictures of the charger for everyone to see.Let me say that I was simply blown away and Anker definitely did not disappoint on this Wall Charger.The technology and design they put into this wall charger is unbelieveable for the low price. I've seen cheap, ugly, and big chargers go for much more.Anker's charger utilizes a simple wall plug that doesn't take up 2 or 3 spots. It is a simple removeable cable extension from the 5 port USB hub that only takes up 1 wall outlet. But it allows me to charge up to 5 devices. This one device alone saved me 4 slots on my surge protector and replaced 5 of my bulky ugly chargers. I had apple chargers, LG chargers, HP chargers, Samsung chargers and all other kinds of bulky wall chargers for my tablets and phones. They all had different amperage rating and were not interchangeable so I had to keep them all plugging in because it was a hassle to remove.Anker eliminated that problem as its charger has smart USB ports. Where past USB ports were hard-wired to exclusively charge iOS or Android, the Smart Port technology creates a truly universal charger. It dynamically adjusts to any device's unique maximum charging speed, the Smart Port takes the brainwork out of compatibility. So this worked with all my devices and no longer do I have to worry about plugging in my device to the right charger. It automatically gives my device the right amount of juice. It also uses top-grade microchips and built-in fail-safes by incorporating a unique port-level circuit protection system that shuts it down in the event of overvoltage, overcurrent, overheating or short circuits. It is truly a safe charger and a genius of a product with the Smart portsIt is a sleek matte finish and the charge can lie flat or standing up depending on how you want it. I have it on my dresser lying down so I don't know it over when I tug on the cables when I'm in a hurry. It's super sleek too and is about the size of a deck of playing card, I believe the dimensions are 3.6 x 2.3 x 1.0in. I love the sleek unibody design and the detachable power cable. It allows for easier storage, packing, and travel.Honestly, it was about time I got rid of all my different chargers. I'm glad Anker has pioneered this new Smart Port technology so I can do so. Never will I have to live with the trouble of finding a free outlet or the right charger for my tablet or smartphone depending on the manufacturer. All I have to do now is plug it in. Technology is supposed to make our lives simpler and this is exactly that the Anker Wall charger does.5 Stars from me. Good work Anker! Keep making newer and better products and keeping them at an affordable price.Packaging:Elegant & simpleEasy to openVery secure and well packedContains:Power cable with velcro management strap40W = 5V * 8A Wall charger with 5 Smart USB portsInstructions & Warranty informationPros:- 40W of power (8 Amps * 5 Volts) plenty for any devices- 5 Smart USB charging ports- 5ft Detachable single plug AC power cord- Sleek black matte unibody design- 18 month Anker Warranty with great customer service- Great green easy-open packaging and fast shipping- Amazing price and great construction- Small, lightweight and portable enough for travel- International use supported ( AC 100-240v input voltage )- Has overvoltage, overcurrent, overheating and short circuits protection with high quality microchips and built-in fail-safes- Replaces all your bulky incompatible and unsightly chargers into one slim devices- Can charge several tablets at once (up to 5)- Compatible with all devices and operating systems. I tried it with Android, iOS, Windows, WebOS, Symbian, ETCCons:- None(Although I wish they included some nice matching USB cables. But I can't blame them since I have enough USB cables laying around and I'm sure everyone else does too. Would have just been a waste and would have increased the cost more. I rather them keep the price down for us and continue to focus on the great products they design and make.)
title: Anker® 40W 5-Port Family-Sized Desktop USB Charger with PowerIQ™ Technology for iPhone 5s 5c 5; iPad Air mini; Galaxy S5 S4; Note 3 2; the new HTC One (M8); Nexus and More (Black)
